title: Document TTS coordinate system and positioning
description:
TTS coordinate system is unintuitive and positioning UI/objects is difficult.

## Approach
Create visual documentation using annotated screenshots:
1. **Location overlay screenshot**: Mark key board positions (showdown board, settlement board, rulebook, resource spawn areas) with colored rectangles and coordinate labels
2. **Grid overlay screenshot**: Show a colored grid with coordinate scale to understand distances

## Deliverables
1. Annotated screenshots in docs/ folder
2. Document coordinate system in ARCHITECTURE.md:
   - Origin location, axis directions, scale
   - Common reference points with coordinates
   - How 3D UI coordinates relate to world coordinates
3. Optional: Console command to show coordinates in real-time (e.g., >showpos)

## Value
Saves time on future UI/object positioning. Current pain point: ResourceRewards button positioning (kdm-w1k.1).

title: Showdown resource rewards button
description:
Add a button to spawn resource rewards after winning a showdown.

## User Story

As a player, after winning a showdown, I want to press a button that automatically draws my resource rewards so that I don't have to manually search through resource decks.

## Current Pain Point

After winning a showdown, players must:
1. Look up which resources they earned (basic + monster-specific)
2. Manually search through the basic resource deck
3. Manually search through the monster resource deck
4. Draw the correct number of random cards from each

## Requirements

### Button Location
- Far right of the Rules Navigation Board (row 2, same as Back/Prev/Next buttons)

### Button Availability
- Available from showdown start until cleanup phase
- Hidden if monster has no resource rewards

### Behavior
When pressed:
1. Determine active showdown (monster type + level)
2. Look up resource rewards for that monster/level (from rulebook data)
3. Draw random cards from the EXISTING decks on showdown board:
   - Basic resource deck (number depends on monster/level)
   - Monster-specific resource deck (number depends on monster/level)
4. Spawn drawn cards to the left of the settlement board

### Design Decision: Use Existing Decks
Resources MUST be drawn from the already-spawned decks on the showdown board, NOT from fresh decks from the archive. Reason: During the showdown, events may allow players to take resources early (e.g., trap cards). Those resources are no longer available as post-showdown rewards. Drawing from existing decks ensures we only give what's actually left.

### Multiple Press Handling
- First press: spawn resources immediately
- Subsequent presses: show confirmation dialog warning that resources were already spawned

### Data Requirements
- Reward data per monster per level (from rulebook):
  - Number of basic resources to draw
  - Number of monster-specific resources to draw
- Monster type + level determined by active showdown

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Button appears on far right of Rules Navigation Board when showdown starts
- [ ] Button styled consistently with other Rules Navigation buttons (DARK_BROWN background, LIGHT_BROWN text)
- [ ] Button hidden if monster has no resource rewards
- [ ] Button spawns correct number of basic resources for current monster/level
- [ ] Button spawns correct number of monster resources for current monster/level
- [ ] **Resources drawn from EXISTING decks on showdown board** (not archive) - run >testrewardsexisting
- [ ] Resources spawn to designated area (left of settlement board)
- [ ] Second press shows confirmation dialog before spawning again
- [ ] Button hidden when showdown ends
- [ ] Works for White Lion (at minimum for initial implementation)

## TTS Test Commands

- `>testrewardsbutton` - Verify button appears on showdown start
- `>testrewardshidden` - Verify button hidden for monsters without resources
- `>testrewardsspawn` - Verify resource data integrity
- `>testrewardsexisting` - Verify draws from existing decks (not archive)
notes:
## Current State (2025-12-08)

### What Works:
- ✅ Button appears on far right of Rules Navigation Board (row 2)
- ✅ Button styled consistently with other Rules buttons (DARK_BROWN/LIGHT_BROWN)
- ✅ Button shows on showdown start, hides on showdown end
- ✅ Button hidden for monsters without resources (e.g., Prologue)
- ✅ Draws from EXISTING decks on showdown board (not archive)
- ✅ Confirmation dialog on second press
- ✅ Test command: >testrewardsexisting verifies existing deck behavior

### Known Issue:
- ❌ Resources spawn ON the showdown board instead of LEFT of settlement board
- LocationData["Resource Rewards"] is set to x=-10, y=2, z=0 which should be left of settlement board
- But cards still appear on showdown board - need to investigate why

### Files Modified:
- ResourceRewards.ttslua - Main module
- LocationData.ttslua - Spawn location definition
- TTSTests/ResourceRewardsTests.ttslua - TTS integration tests
- ARCHITECTURE.md - Documentation

### Next Steps:
1. Debug why cards spawn at wrong location (possibly Container:Take behavior?)
2. May need to use different spawn mechanism or adjust coordinates further
